author: Campo Grande News
title: Chuva forte em Campo Grande adia abertura da Cidade do Natal
text:
Chuva forte em Campo Grande adia abertura da Cidade do Natal
Evento estava marcado para a noite desta sexta-feira (13) e foi adiado para este sábado (14)
A abertura oficial da Cidade do Natal, nos altos da Avenida Afonso Pena, precisou ser remarcada para este sábado (14), às 19h. O evento estava agendado para esta sexta-feira (13), mas foi adiado devido às fortes chuvas e tempestades que atingiram a Capital durante a tarde.
Em nota, a Prefeitura de Campo Grande informa que a programação permanece repleta de atrações. Amanhã, o evento vai contar com a Parada Natalina com a Família Rena e o show nacional para o público infantil com os queridos Patati Patatá.
Sobre a tradicional Caravana de Natal da Coca-Cola, que percorreria as ruas da cidade e chegaria ao local, ainda não há confirmação sobre adiamento.
Receba as principais notícias do Estado pelo Whats. [Clique aqui para acessar o canal do Campo Grande News](https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va6UwSHHltY8c4OtUb0j) e siga nossas [redes sociais](https://www.tiktok.com/@campograndenews?_t=8jKPysGs6SL&_r=1).

author: greatesthitsuk
title: Parking charges lowered in York following backlash
text:
Changes to some parking charges in York following backlash from businesses
Prices went up in April y
Some changes to parking charges in York are coming into force today (17 July).
The new pricing model introduces a price of £3 per hour (or £2.10 per hour for residents with a Minster discount badge) for a maximum of 3 hours in community car parks and residential areas outside the inner ring road.
Councillor Kate Ravilious, Executive Member for Transport:
“Following the introduction of new charges across the city earlier in the year, we listened to what people were telling us and made some adjustments. These changes are now being put in place.
“We’re grateful for those who’ve worked with us in reaching these decisions.
“While we remain committed to tackling congestion and making it easier for everyone to get around, we recognise some of the uplift in charges in areas where they were previously very low has felt too much in one go.
“Alongside the changes to parking charges aimed at supporting residents and local businesses, we will continue to invest in improving bus services, including extending Park and Ride hours from the 20 July; and developing walking and cycling provision in York to provide alternative travel options in York.”
Different car-parking charges will be applied depending on the area the parking is located in, with lower rates in community car parks and on-street areas serving residential and local high streets outside of the inner ring road.
These car parks include: Bishopthorpe Road car park; East Parade car park and Rowntree Park car park.
Other changes that will come into effect, include:
• On-street parking charges in areas outside of the inner ring road will move to the £3 per hour rate
• an increase in the discount for the Minster Badge to 30% of the standard parking charge, from the current 24% to reduce the impact of increased parking charges on residents
• No Friday, Saturday, event uplift or evening charge at Community car parks or on-street parking areas outside of the inner ring road.
• adjustment to charges in the Micklegate and Priory Street area to the ‘outside the inner ring road’ on-street parking rate. City centre evening parking rates for this area will still apply
• removing the proposed charges for dedicated motorcycle bays, recognising that the motorcycle bays are generally in locations where a car space is not possible
• increase the discount for Low Emission vehicle permits to 20%, from the current 16% discount to set a discount that better reflects the contribution of all types of vehicles to congestion and takes into account the land-use impact of vehicle parking
• Contract Parking permits will no longer be linked to Season Tickets, and will be set at last year’s prices, plus circa 5% increase, with a 20% discount for low emission vehicles
• Coppergate car park will also be implementing cashless parking from 17 July, cash payments will still be accepted in Bootham Row and Castle Car Park
Hear all the latest news from across the UK on the hour, every hour, on Greatest Hits Radio on DAB, smartspeaker, at greatesthitsradio.co.uk, and on the Rayo app.

author: MICHAEL ADKISON | KEYE Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}The man shot and killed by officers Tuesday at a Texas apartment complex was carrying a BB gun, not a rifle as police originally reported, the department confirmed Wednesday.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"KEYE\" data-caption=\"Man%20fatally%20shot%20by%20officers%20at%20Texas%20apartment%20complex%20was%20holding%20BB%20gun,%20police%20say%20(KEYE)\" data-duration=\"163.072\" data-externalid=\"fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e\" data-mediatype=\"video\" data-renditions=\"\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media/82177ca6-0726-4896-8b6f-905568ba6e1a-medium16x9_thumb_61595.png\" data-title=\"Man%20fatally%20shot%20by%20officers%20at%20Texas%20apartment%20complex%20was%20holding%20BB%20gun,%20police%20say\" data-url=\"https://content.uplynk.com/fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e.m3u8?tc=1&exp=1703869728&rn=1526628551&ct=a&cid=fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e&hlsver=7&sig=362be031e5decfbca71e1e2f6130e5971a411140283c9fd7f3301f40b3301d35\" data-defaultthumb=\"\" data-embed-file=\"%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-video-media%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Ciframe%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20width=%22560%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20height=%22315%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20class=%22sda-embeded-player-iframe%20sda-VideoEmbed-iframe%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20src=%22/resources/embeds/vod.html?externalId=fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20frameborder=%22no%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/iframe%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-video-info%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed-stopImage%22%20src=%22/resources/media/82177ca6-0726-4896-8b6f-905568ba6e1a-medium16x9_thumb_61595.png%22/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed-caption%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cspan%3ECaption:%20Man%20fatally%20shot%20by%20officers%20at%20Texas%20apartment%20complex%20was%20holding%20BB%20gun,%20police%20say%20(KEYE)%3C/span%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}KEYE broke the story after Interim Police Chief Robin Henderson had first noted in a news briefing Tuesday evening that, just a minute before an officer pulled the trigger, that \"he was unsure if it was a rifle or a BB gun.”{br}{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1740132297880547612\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Reporters from at least five outlets were only allowed to ask three total questions in Tuesday's briefing, so KEYE was unable to get immediate clarification on the nature of the weapon allegedly held by the victim. A KEYE reporter did ask specifically how many shots were fired and if the weapon put anyone in immediate danger, to which Henderson only said the investigation was ongoing.{br}{/p}{p}Police confirmed the object was a BB gun on Wednesday.{/p}{p}Tuesday's shooting marked the fourth officer-involved shooting in December, including one last week, and one during the December 5 violent spree, in which {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/police-say-shooting-spree-suspect-murdered-parents-in-san-antonio-before-austin-killings\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/police-say-shooting-spree-suspect-murdered-parents-in-san-antonio-before-austin-killings\"}six people were killed{/a} and three people, including two officers, were injured.{/p}{p}In an unrelated event on Wednesday morning, Henderson told reporters the police force was still facing a shortage of about 340 officers. Law enforcement advocates said that shortage might further contribute to high-stress responses.{/p}{p}\"By not providing adequate staffing to the department, you are fostering an environment where officers are overworked; where they are stressed; where they are having to do more than just their 40 assigned hours,\" Michael Bullock, the president-elect of the Austin Police Association, said on Wednesday before police confirmed the weapon was a BB gun. \"Ultimately, we're fostering this environment where you're setting officers up to be involved in these situations more.\"{/p}{p}During Tuesday's briefing, Henderson said that officers initially responded around 1:18 p.m. to reports of a man firing what was believed to be a rifle in the parking lot of a northeast Austin apartment building.{/p}{p}The first officers on scene reported seeing the man point what they believed was a rifle at them as they drove through the lot.{/p}{p}The man continued pointing the weapon at the officers as they took cover behind vehicles in the parking lot. Over the radio, an officer stated that they were not sure if it was a rifle or a BB gun. He continued to point the weapon at officers as they ordered him to drop it.{ }{/p}{p}One officer opened fire, striking him. Officers rendered aid, but he was pronounced dead at the scene.
